mistream LOCAL mistream

NAME

mjo_istream_push — push back an UTF-8 character onto an input stream

SYNOPSIS

#include <mistream.h>

void
mjo_istream_push(mjo_istream_t const io_stream, struct mjo_utf8 const *const i_peek);

DESCRIPTION

mjo_istream_push() is like ungetc(3) in functionality. It provides a method to allow the caller to push back an UTF-8 character to the input stream io_stream. When the next read is performed, if any UTF-8 characters exists in the push back queue (LIFO), the last one will be popped and returned.

Following is a description of the arguments.

io_stream
pointer to a ‘mjo_istream_t’ that shall place the character onto it's queue
i_peek
UTF-8 character to push back

If o_stream or i_peek is nil, no operations will be performed.

November 25, 2021 OpenBSD 7.0
